original_title: Thriposha Production Temporarily Halted Due to Shortage of Maize
original_body_lines: COLOMBO (News 1st) - Thriposha production in Sri Lanka has been temporarily suspended.The Sri Lanka Thriposha Company announced that the suspension was due to the unavailability of maize required for production.Cabinet approval had earlier been granted to import 18,000 metric tons of maize for Thriposha production. However, the Controller General of Imports and Exports has presented amendments to the approval.Chairman of the Sri Lanka Thriposha Limited, Amal Attanayake, stated that until the new Cabinet paper, inclusive of those amendments, is presented to the Cabinet on the 7th and receives approval, the maize importation has been halted.As a result, production of Thriposha has been on hold since the 21st of September.The Chairman further noted that once maize imports resume after the 7th of October, Thriposha production will return to normal. He added that the stocks already produced are currently being distributed across the country.
